purpleculture_pinyin:
dí
Anaphalis yedoensis (pearly everlasting reed); used in Japanese names with phonetic value Ogi
Anaphalis yedoensis (вечный жемчужный тростник); используется в японских именах с фонетическим значением Оги
purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 狄 indicates the sound; 艹 (grass) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
芦荻 [ lú dí ]: reeds
画荻教子 [ huà dí jiào zǐ ]: to write on the sand with reeds while teaching one's son (idiom); mother's admirable dedication to her children's education
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿱ Above to below
    • 艹 [ cǎo ] grass, weed, plant, herb
    • 狄 [ dí ] barbarians; a tribe from northern China; surname
heisig_constituent: reed, flowers, pack of wild dogs, fire
heisig_story: You've no doubt seen cattails, those swamp reeds with a furry flower to them like the tail of a cat. This might just turn out to be a good way to get rid of a troublesome pack of wild dogs: lure them into a swamp of these reeds with the cattail flowers and then set fire to the swamp. Take care to focus on the flower rather than the "cattail" to avoid confusion with frame 259 below.
myStory: там можно спрятаться от стаи и огня (?)
koohiiStory1: REEDS are the only FLOWERS that WILD DOGS like to FIRE up and smoke while they are playing poker.
koohiiStory2: A reed is a flower that looks like a hot dog.
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the grass (艹) that gets the dog (犭) on fire (火) is a reed

Liushutong characters (3)

荻字的基本解释

荻
dí
多年生草本植物，生在水边，叶子长形，似芦苇，秋天开紫花，茎可以编席箔。

荻字的汉语字典释义

[①]［dí］
［《廣韻》徒歷切，入鍚，定。］
亦作“蔐1”。亦作“藡1”。
多年生草本植物，与芦同类。生长在水边。根茎都有节似竹，叶抱茎生，秋天生紫色或白色、草黄色花穗，茎可以编席箔。

荻字的康熙字典解释

【申集上】【艸字部】　荻； 康熙笔画：13； 页码：页1032第18
【唐韻】徒歷切【韻會】亭歷切，?音狄。【說文】萑也。【爾雅·釋草】蕭，荻。【註】卽蒿。【戰國策】公宮之垣，皆以荻、蒿、苫、楚廧之。【晉書·童謠】官家養蘆花爲荻。　又地名。【前漢·功臣表】荻苴侯韓陶。【史記·索隱】荻苴，在渤海。　【正字通】《廣雅》作藡。

荻字的源字形

荻字的起名意思

：多年生草本植物，似芦苇。

Di
Basic explanation of words
Di
dí
A perennial herb that grows by the water's edge, with long leaves resembling reeds. It blooms with purple flowers in autumn and the stems can be woven into foil.
Di
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［dí］
["Guangyun" cuts through the calendar, enters and sets. ]
Also known as "蔐1". Also known as "藡1".
Perennial herb, similar to reed. Grows by the water. The rhizomes are all knotted like bamboo, the leaves hold the stems, and the purple or white, grassy yellow flower spikes grow in autumn. The stems can be woven into foil.
Di
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Shen Ji 1] [Department of Chinese characters] 　di; Kangxi strokes: 13; Page number: page 1032 to 18
【Tang Yun】Ting Liqie 【Yunhui】Ting Liqie,? Yindi. [Said the text] 萑 also. [Erya Shicao] Xiao, Di. [Note] Artemisia annua. [Warring States Policy] The walls of the public palace are all based on Di, Artemisia, thatch, and Chuyu. [Jin Shu·Nursery Rhymes] The official family raises reed flowers as Di.　Also place name. [Former Han · Heroes List] Di Juhou Han Tao. 【Historical Records·Suoyin】Diju, in the Bohai Sea.　【Zhengzitong】"Guangya" is used as 藡.
Di

Di
Name meaning
: Perennial herb, resembling reed.
犹(獲,穫)huo
[附] 隻(只)
原作“隻”。字形像一只手抓
住了鸟,本义是“捕获”。甲骨下
辞;“贞:王往逐慶,隻”。金文铭
文:“战,隻兵铜”。小篆加“犬”旁
表示捕获禽兽;又加“未”旁表示
农业收获。简化字将“獲”“催”合
获
二为一。
线
司
蕸反獲
Получить
Только [Прикреплено] (только)
Оригинал "только".
Персонаж похож на руку, ловящую птицу, изначальное значение - «поймать».
Слова под костями оракула: «Чжэнь: Ван идет только праздновать».
Золотая надпись: «Война, только солдаты медные».
Добавление слова «собака» рядом с Сяочжуань означает отлов животных, добавление «не» рядом с ним означает сельскохозяйственный урожай.
Упрощенные китайские иероглифы объединяют «得» и «時» в одно целое.
